title: Macron blasts 'crackpots' reacting to video of plane exit with his wife
summary: The French president responded from Hanoi, Vietnam, to the alleged 'slap' the first lady gave him aboard the presidential plane, after his team dismissed the video as 'fake.'

title: Ukraine says Russia launched its biggest drone attack since the start of the war
summary: The three consecutive nights of Russian bombardment come after Kyiv accepted an unconditional 30-day ceasefire in March, proposed by the US, but that Moscow effectively rejected. Russia's Defense Ministry, meanwhile, said Monday that its forces shot down 103 Ukrainian drones overnight that were flying over southern and western Russia, including near Moscow.

title: Driver arrested after car hits pedestrians at Liverpool parade
summary: Authorities, during a press conference on Monday, said they think it was an 'isolated incident' and are 'not currently looking for anyone else in relation to it,' adding a 53-year-old British man had been arrested.

title: In Ukraine, behind the prisoner exchanges, the anguish of families of the missing
summary: Moscow and Kyiv exchanged 1,000 people each – including 880 military personnel and 120 civilians – between Friday, May 23, and Sunday, May 25. Many Ukrainians gathered to witness the return of prisoners, hoping for news of missing family members.

title: NASA restarts one of Voyager 1's thrusters after 21 years of inactivity
summary: With Voyager 1's backup roll thruster at risk of becoming blocked, engineers at the Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) managed to relight the spacecraft's main thruster, nearly 25 billion kilometers away.

title: In Argentina, 'The Eternaut' series rekindles search for babies stolen during the dictatorship
summary: Some 500 children of regime opponents were taken from their parents under the military junta (1976-1983) and subjected to forced adoptions.

title: Germany's Merz says Western allies no longer impose range limits on Ukrainian weapons
summary: The German chancellor said on Monday that the lifting of these restrictions will allow Ukraine to strike military positions in Russia and added that his government would strategically no longer detail what arms it is sending to Ukraine.

title: Child abuser Le Scouarnec asks for no 'leniency' as trial verdict looms
summary: Former French surgeon Joël Le Scouarnec has confessed to raping or sexually assaulting nearly 300 patients as prosecutors seek the maximum sentence and post-release supervision.

title: French Open: Carolina Garcia bids emotional farewell to crowd after losing in the first round
summary: The 31-year-old French star, set to retire later this season, thanked fans through tears after a first-round loss, ending a 14-year French Open journey.

title: Venezuela's Maduro wins landslide in election boycotted by opposition
summary: The United Socialist Party of Venezuela won 23 out of 24 state governor positions and scored 82.68% of the votes cast for lists of National Assembly members, the electoral council said.

title: ECB's Lagarde slams Trump's 'terrible language' about the EU
summary: The European Central Bank president criticized the US president over his claim that the bloc was formed to 'screw' the United States. Trump made the comments earlier this year as he threatened to hit the EU with hefty tariffs.

title: French Open: Naomi Osaka eliminated by Paula Badosa in the first round
summary: The four-time Grand Slam champion was undone by 54 unforced errors and lost in the French Open's first round to 10th-seeded Paula Badosa 6-7 (1), 6-1, 6-4 on Monday.

title: Jafar Pahani returns to Tehran to hero's welcome after winning Palme d'or
summary: The Iranian director, who had long faced travel and filmmaking bans, was warmly welcomed at the airport – an atmosphere that stood in stark contrast to the muted response from state media and government officials.

title: Russia takes over a second Orthodox church in Nice
summary: The courts have ruled in favor of Moscow, which claimed ownership of the French Riviera church that had been managed for more than a century by descendants of White Russian émigrés. Representatives of Russia have already sent a bailiff to the site.

title: Two Polands face off ahead of decisive week
summary: Warsaw's liberal mayor Rafal Trzaskowski and nationalist historian Karol Nawrocki each staged massive gatherings in Warsaw on Sunday, to rally their supporters in the final stretch of the presidential election. The second round will take place on June 1.

title: 'Charlie Hebdo' files complaint over fake covers, blaming 'pro-Russian propaganda'
summary: The satirical magazine filed a complaint for counterfeiting with a Paris court after mock front pages disparaging Ukraine were shared on social media.

title: Former French PM faces backlash over proposal to ban headscarves for children
summary: Gabriel Attal, the head of President Macron's party, said he wanted to ban under-15s from wearing Muslim headscarves in public spaces. In response, there has been an outcry across the political spectrum, except on the far right.

title: Trump backtracks on new tariff threats against EU
summary: After a call with European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen, the US president postponed a possible increase in tariffs on products imported into the United States until July 9. He had threatened on Friday to impose a 50% tariff starting June 1.

title: French MPs are due to vote on assisted dying bill
summary: Key points were clarified during the bill's examination, as those who support a right to assisted dying sought to avoid giving opponents any ammunition. The Assemblée Nationale's vote is scheduled for Tuesday.

title: In Venezuela, Maduro claims landslide win in elections amid opposition boycott
summary: The party of President Nicolas Maduro has won 40 out of 50 seats, though the divided opposition has denounced irregularities in the vote count.

title: Deadly attacks on villages in central Nigeria
summary: The attacks hit three villages between Friday and Sunday, says Ormin Torsar Victor, head of the Gwer West local government, who reported around 30 deaths, a figure that has not been confirmed by local police.

title: 'We will drive out the Arabs': In Jerusalem, the open racism of Israel's nationalist religious youth
summary: Tens of thousands of young men, activists from Israel's far-right religious movement, marched for Jerusalem Day on Monday to celebrate the capture and annexation of East Jerusalem in 1967, hurling insults at Palestinian residents.

title: Are Germans lazy? Their leader wants them to work more
summary: Friedrich Merz, the new conservative chancellor, believes Germany must increase its time spent working to regain prosperity. But the options that could achieve this remain divisive.

title: Immigration: Nine European countries seek to weaken the European Court of Human Rights
summary: A group of states, led by Italy, Denmark and Austria, called to rethink how the ECHR is interpreted in order to reduce its influence over European migration policy.

title: French Polynesia nuclear tests: How the Atomic Energy Commission is funding a counter-narrative on contamination
summary: A parliamentary commission of inquiry is seeking to understand whether the French government underestimated the number of victims to limit compensation payments. In 2022, the Atomic Energy Commission launched a costly campaign to counter an alarming investigation's findings.

title: Canada divided over Charles III's royal visit
summary: Prime Minister Mark Carney has invited the British monarch to defend this Commonwealth country against attacks from US President Donald Trump.

title: In Japan, the spirit of mingei is still alive
summary: Their strength lies in patience and the ancestral skills they bring to the workbench every day, working in the spirit of mingei – a folk art movement launched in 1925, of which they are the heirs. A century later, these lacquerers, potters, weavers and dyers who celebrate the simple beauty of everyday objects stand as resisters.

title: Novak Djokovic faced with 'new reality' of not being number one anymore
summary: At 38, the Serbian tennis player's chances of another triumph at the French Open, where he plays his first match on Tuesday, appear slim.

title: AI: Salesforce buys Informatica for $8 billion
summary: Announced on Tuesday, the deal will give Salesforce access to AI-powered cloud data management company Informatica's data management capabilities.
